26/**
27 * DOC: Frame Buffer Compression (FBC)
28 *
29 * FBC tries to save memory bandwidth (and so power consumption) by
30 * compressing the amount of memory used by the display. It is total
31 * transparent to user space and completely handled in the kernel.
32 *
33 * The benefits of FBC are mostly visible with solid backgrounds and
34 * variation-less patterns. It comes from keeping the memory footprint small
35 * and having fewer memory pages opened and accessed for refreshing the display.
36 *
37 * i915 is responsible to reserve stolen memory for FBC and configure its
38 * offset on proper registers. The hardware takes care of all
39 * compress/decompress. However there are many known cases where we have to
40 * forcibly disable it to allow proper screen updates.
41 */
42
43#include <sys/cdefs.h>
44__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_fbc.c,v 1.4 2018/09/13 08:25:55 mrg Exp $");
45
46#include "intel_drv.h"
47#include "i915_drv.h"
48
49static inline bool fbc_supported(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
50{
51 return dev_priv->fbc.enable_fbc != NULL;
52}
53
54/*
55 * In some platforms where the CRTC's x:0/y:0 coordinates doesn't match the
56 * frontbuffer's x:0/y:0 coordinates we lie to the hardware about the plane's
57 * origin so the x and y offsets can actually fit the registers. As a
58 * consequence, the fence doesn't really start exactly at the display plane
59 * address we program because it starts at the real start of the buffer, so we
60 * have to take this into consideration here.
61 */
62static unsigned int get_crtc_fence_y_offset(struct intel_crtc *crtc)
63{
64 return crtc->base.y - crtc->adjusted_y;
65}
66
67static void i8xx_fbc_disable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
68{
69 u32 fbc_ctl;
70
71 dev_priv->fbc.enabled = false;
72
73 /* Disable compression */
74 fbc_ctl = I915_READ(FBC_CONTROL);
75 if ((fbc_ctl & FBC_CTL_EN) == 0)
76 return;
77
78 fbc_ctl &= ~FBC_CTL_EN;
79 I915_WRITE(FBC_CONTROL, fbc_ctl);
80
81 /* Wait for compressing bit to clear */
82 if (wait_for((I915_READ(FBC_STATUS) & FBC_STAT_COMPRESSING) == 0, 10)) {
83 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("FBC idle timed out\n");
84 return;
85 }
86
87 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("disabled FBC\n");
88}
89
90static void i8xx_fbc_enable(struct intel_crtc *crtc)
91{
92 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
93 struct drm_framebuffer *fb = crtc->base.primary->fb;
94 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = intel_fb_obj(fb);
95 int cfb_pitch;
96 int i;
97 u32 fbc_ctl;
98
99 dev_priv->fbc.enabled = true;
100
101 /* Note: fbc.threshold == 1 for i8xx */
102 cfb_pitch = dev_priv->fbc.uncompressed_size / FBC_LL_SIZE;
103 if (fb->pitches[0] < cfb_pitch)
104 cfb_pitch = fb->pitches[0];
105
106 /* FBC_CTL wants 32B or 64B units */
107 if (IS_GEN2(dev_priv))
108 cfb_pitch = (cfb_pitch / 32) - 1;
109 else
110 cfb_pitch = (cfb_pitch / 64) - 1;
111
112 /* Clear old tags */
113 for (i = 0; i < (FBC_LL_SIZE / 32) + 1; i++)
114 I915_WRITE(FBC_TAG(i), 0);
115
116 if (IS_GEN4(dev_priv)) {
117 u32 fbc_ctl2;
118
119 /* Set it up... */
120 fbc_ctl2 = FBC_CTL_FENCE_DBL | FBC_CTL_IDLE_IMM | FBC_CTL_CPU_FENCE;
121 fbc_ctl2 |= FBC_CTL_PLANE(crtc->plane);
122 I915_WRITE(FBC_CONTROL2, fbc_ctl2);
123 I915_WRITE(FBC_FENCE_OFF, get_crtc_fence_y_offset(crtc));
124 }
125
126 /* enable it... */
127 fbc_ctl = I915_READ(FBC_CONTROL);
128 fbc_ctl &= 0x3fff << FBC_CTL_INTERVAL_SHIFT;
129 fbc_ctl |= FBC_CTL_EN | FBC_CTL_PERIODIC;
130 if (IS_I945GM(dev_priv))
131 fbc_ctl |= FBC_CTL_C3_IDLE; /* 945 needs special SR handling */
132 fbc_ctl |= (cfb_pitch & 0xff) << FBC_CTL_STRIDE_SHIFT;
133 fbc_ctl |= obj->fence_reg;
134 I915_WRITE(FBC_CONTROL, fbc_ctl);
135
136 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("enabled FBC, pitch %d, yoff %d, plane %c\n",
137 cfb_pitch, crtc->base.y, plane_name(crtc->plane));
138}
139
140static bool i8xx_fbc_enabled(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
141{
142 return I915_READ(FBC_CONTROL) & FBC_CTL_EN;
143}
144
145static void g4x_fbc_enable(struct intel_crtc *crtc)
146{
147 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
148 struct drm_framebuffer *fb = crtc->base.primary->fb;
149 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = intel_fb_obj(fb);
150 u32 dpfc_ctl;
151
152 dev_priv->fbc.enabled = true;
153
154 dpfc_ctl = DPFC_CTL_PLANE(crtc->plane) | DPFC_SR_EN;
155 if (drm_format_plane_cpp(fb->pixel_format, 0) == 2)
156 dpfc_ctl |= DPFC_CTL_LIMIT_2X;
157 else
158 dpfc_ctl |= DPFC_CTL_LIMIT_1X;
159 dpfc_ctl |= DPFC_CTL_FENCE_EN | obj->fence_reg;
160
161 I915_WRITE(DPFC_FENCE_YOFF, get_crtc_fence_y_offset(crtc));
162
163 /* enable it... */
164 I915_WRITE(DPFC_CONTROL, dpfc_ctl | DPFC_CTL_EN);
165
166 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("enabled fbc on plane %c\n", plane_name(crtc->plane));
167}
168
169static void g4x_fbc_disable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
170{
171 u32 dpfc_ctl;
172
173 dev_priv->fbc.enabled = false;
174
175 /* Disable compression */
176 dpfc_ctl = I915_READ(DPFC_CONTROL);
177 if (dpfc_ctl & DPFC_CTL_EN) {
178 dpfc_ctl &= ~DPFC_CTL_EN;
179 I915_WRITE(DPFC_CONTROL, dpfc_ctl);
180
181 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("disabled FBC\n");
182 }
183}
184
185static bool g4x_fbc_enabled(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
186{
187 return I915_READ(DPFC_CONTROL) & DPFC_CTL_EN;
188}
189
190static void intel_fbc_nuke(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
191{
192 I915_WRITE(MSG_FBC_REND_STATE, FBC_REND_NUKE);
193 POSTING_READ(MSG_FBC_REND_STATE);
194}
195
196static void ilk_fbc_enable(struct intel_crtc *crtc)
197{
198 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
199 struct drm_framebuffer *fb = crtc->base.primary->fb;
200 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = intel_fb_obj(fb);
201 u32 dpfc_ctl;
202 int threshold = dev_priv->fbc.threshold;
203 unsigned int y_offset;
204
205 dev_priv->fbc.enabled = true;
206
207 dpfc_ctl = DPFC_CTL_PLANE(crtc->plane);
208 if (drm_format_plane_cpp(fb->pixel_format, 0) == 2)
209 threshold++;
210
211 switch (threshold) {
212 case 4:
213 case 3:
214 dpfc_ctl |= DPFC_CTL_LIMIT_4X;
215 break;
216 case 2:
217 dpfc_ctl |= DPFC_CTL_LIMIT_2X;
218 break;
219 case 1:
220 dpfc_ctl |= DPFC_CTL_LIMIT_1X;
221 break;
222 }
223 dpfc_ctl |= DPFC_CTL_FENCE_EN;
224 if (IS_GEN5(dev_priv))
225 dpfc_ctl |= obj->fence_reg;
226
227 y_offset = get_crtc_fence_y_offset(crtc);
228 I915_WRITE(ILK_DPFC_FENCE_YOFF, y_offset);
229 I915_WRITE(ILK_FBC_RT_BASE, i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj) | ILK_FBC_RT_VALID);
230 /* enable it... */
231 I915_WRITE(ILK_DPFC_CONTROL, dpfc_ctl | DPFC_CTL_EN);
232
233 if (IS_GEN6(dev_priv)) {
234 I915_WRITE(SNB_DPFC_CTL_SA,
235 SNB_CPU_FENCE_ENABLE | obj->fence_reg);
236 I915_WRITE(DPFC_CPU_FENCE_OFFSET, y_offset);
237 }
238
239 intel_fbc_nuke(dev_priv);
240
241 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("enabled fbc on plane %c\n", plane_name(crtc->plane));
242}
243
244static void ilk_fbc_disable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
245{
246 u32 dpfc_ctl;
247
248 dev_priv->fbc.enabled = false;
249
250 /* Disable compression */
251 dpfc_ctl = I915_READ(ILK_DPFC_CONTROL);
252 if (dpfc_ctl & DPFC_CTL_EN) {
253 dpfc_ctl &= ~DPFC_CTL_EN;
254 I915_WRITE(ILK_DPFC_CONTROL, dpfc_ctl);
255
256 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("disabled FBC\n");
257 }
258}
259
260static bool ilk_fbc_enabled(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
261{
262 return I915_READ(ILK_DPFC_CONTROL) & DPFC_CTL_EN;
263}
264
265static void gen7_fbc_enable(struct intel_crtc *crtc)
266{
267 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
268 struct drm_framebuffer *fb = crtc->base.primary->fb;
269 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = intel_fb_obj(fb);
270 u32 dpfc_ctl;
271 int threshold = dev_priv->fbc.threshold;
272
273 dev_priv->fbc.enabled = true;
274
275 dpfc_ctl = 0;
276 if (IS_IVYBRIDGE(dev_priv))
277 dpfc_ctl |= IVB_DPFC_CTL_PLANE(crtc->plane);
278
279 if (drm_format_plane_cpp(fb->pixel_format, 0) == 2)
280 threshold++;
281
282 switch (threshold) {
283 case 4:
284 case 3:
285 dpfc_ctl |= DPFC_CTL_LIMIT_4X;
286 break;
287 case 2:
288 dpfc_ctl |= DPFC_CTL_LIMIT_2X;
289 break;
290 case 1:
291 dpfc_ctl |= DPFC_CTL_LIMIT_1X;
292 break;
293 }
294
295 dpfc_ctl |= IVB_DPFC_CTL_FENCE_EN;
296
297 if (dev_priv->fbc.false_color)
298 dpfc_ctl |= FBC_CTL_FALSE_COLOR;
299
300 if (IS_IVYBRIDGE(dev_priv)) {
301 /* WaFbcAsynchFlipDisableFbcQueue:ivb */
302 I915_WRITE(ILK_DISPLAY_CHICKEN1,
303 I915_READ(ILK_DISPLAY_CHICKEN1) |
304 ILK_FBCQ_DIS);
305 } else if (IS_HASWELL(dev_priv) || IS_BROADWELL(dev_priv)) {
306 /* WaFbcAsynchFlipDisableFbcQueue:hsw,bdw */
307 I915_WRITE(CHICKEN_PIPESL_1(crtc->pipe),
308 I915_READ(CHICKEN_PIPESL_1(crtc->pipe)) |
309 HSW_FBCQ_DIS);
310 }
311
312 I915_WRITE(ILK_DPFC_CONTROL, dpfc_ctl | DPFC_CTL_EN);
313
314 I915_WRITE(SNB_DPFC_CTL_SA,
315 SNB_CPU_FENCE_ENABLE | obj->fence_reg);
316 I915_WRITE(DPFC_CPU_FENCE_OFFSET, get_crtc_fence_y_offset(crtc));
317
318 intel_fbc_nuke(dev_priv);
319
320 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("enabled fbc on plane %c\n", plane_name(crtc->plane));
321}
322
323/**
324 * intel_fbc_enabled - Is FBC enabled?
325 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
326 *
327 * This function is used to verify the current state of FBC.
328 * FIXME: This should be tracked in the plane config eventually
329 * instead of queried at runtime for most callers.
330 */
331bool intel_fbc_enabled(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
332{
333 return dev_priv->fbc.enabled;
334}
335
336static void intel_fbc_enable(struct intel_crtc *crtc,
337 const struct drm_framebuffer *fb)
338{
339 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
340
341 dev_priv->fbc.enable_fbc(crtc);
342
343 dev_priv->fbc.crtc = crtc;
344 dev_priv->fbc.fb_id = fb->base.id;
345 dev_priv->fbc.y = crtc->base.y;
346}
347
348static void intel_fbc_work_fn(struct work_struct *__work)
349{
350 struct intel_fbc_work *work =
351 container_of(to_delayed_work(__work),
352 struct intel_fbc_work, work);
353 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = work->crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
354 struct drm_framebuffer *crtc_fb = work->crtc->base.primary->fb;
355
356 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
357 if (work == dev_priv->fbc.fbc_work) {
358 /* Double check that we haven't switched fb without cancelling
359 * the prior work.
360 */
361 if (crtc_fb == work->fb)
362 intel_fbc_enable(work->crtc, work->fb);
363
364 dev_priv->fbc.fbc_work = NULL;
365 }
366 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
367
368 kfree(work);
369}
370
371static void intel_fbc_cancel_work(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
372{
373 WARN_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&dev_priv->fbc.lock));
374
375 if (dev_priv->fbc.fbc_work == NULL)
376 return;
377
378 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("cancelling pending FBC enable\n");
379
380 /* Synchronisation is provided by struct_mutex and checking of
381 * dev_priv->fbc.fbc_work, so we can perform the cancellation
382 * entirely asynchronously.
383 */
384 if (cancel_delayed_work(&dev_priv->fbc.fbc_work->work))
385 /* tasklet was killed before being run, clean up */
386 kfree(dev_priv->fbc.fbc_work);
387
388 /* Mark the work as no longer wanted so that if it does
389 * wake-up (because the work was already running and waiting
390 * for our mutex), it will discover that is no longer
391 * necessary to run.
392 */
393 dev_priv->fbc.fbc_work = NULL;
394}
395
396static void intel_fbc_schedule_enable(struct intel_crtc *crtc)
397{
398 struct intel_fbc_work *work;
399 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
400
401 WARN_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&dev_priv->fbc.lock));
402
403 intel_fbc_cancel_work(dev_priv);
404
405 work = kzalloc(sizeof(*work), GFP_KERNEL);
406 if (work == NULL) {
407 DRM_ERROR("Failed to allocate FBC work structure\n");
408 intel_fbc_enable(crtc, crtc->base.primary->fb);
409 return;
410 }
411
412 work->crtc = crtc;
413 work->fb = crtc->base.primary->fb;
414 INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&work->work, intel_fbc_work_fn);
415
416 dev_priv->fbc.fbc_work = work;
417
418 /* Delay the actual enabling to let pageflipping cease and the
419 * display to settle before starting the compression. Note that
420 * this delay also serves a second purpose: it allows for a
421 * vblank to pass after disabling the FBC before we attempt
422 * to modify the control registers.
423 *
424 * A more complicated solution would involve tracking vblanks
425 * following the termination of the page-flipping sequence
426 * and indeed performing the enable as a co-routine and not
427 * waiting synchronously upon the vblank.
428 *
429 * WaFbcWaitForVBlankBeforeEnable:ilk,snb
430 */
431 schedule_delayed_work(&work->work, msecs_to_jiffies(50));
432}
433
434static void __intel_fbc_disable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
435{
436 WARN_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&dev_priv->fbc.lock));
437
438 intel_fbc_cancel_work(dev_priv);
439
440 dev_priv->fbc.disable_fbc(dev_priv);
441 dev_priv->fbc.crtc = NULL;
442}
443
444/**
445 * intel_fbc_disable - disable FBC
446 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
447 *
448 * This function disables FBC.
449 */
450void intel_fbc_disable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
451{
452 if (!fbc_supported(dev_priv))
453 return;
454
455 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
456 __intel_fbc_disable(dev_priv);
457 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
458}
459
460/*
461 * intel_fbc_disable_crtc - disable FBC if it's associated with crtc
462 * @crtc: the CRTC
463 *
464 * This function disables FBC if it's associated with the provided CRTC.
465 */
466void intel_fbc_disable_crtc(struct intel_crtc *crtc)
467{
468 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
469
470 if (!fbc_supported(dev_priv))
471 return;
472
473 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
474 if (dev_priv->fbc.crtc == crtc)
475 __intel_fbc_disable(dev_priv);
476 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
477}
478
479const char *intel_no_fbc_reason_str(enum no_fbc_reason reason)
480{
481 switch (reason) {
482 case FBC_OK:
483 return "FBC enabled but currently disabled in hardware";
484 case FBC_UNSUPPORTED:
485 return "unsupported by this chipset";
486 case FBC_NO_OUTPUT:
487 return "no output";
488 case FBC_STOLEN_TOO_SMALL:
489 return "not enough stolen memory";
490 case FBC_UNSUPPORTED_MODE:
491 return "mode incompatible with compression";
492 case FBC_MODE_TOO_LARGE:
493 return "mode too large for compression";
494 case FBC_BAD_PLANE:
495 return "FBC unsupported on plane";
496 case FBC_NOT_TILED:
497 return "framebuffer not tiled or fenced";
498 case FBC_MULTIPLE_PIPES:
499 return "more than one pipe active";
500 case FBC_MODULE_PARAM:
501 return "disabled per module param";
502 case FBC_CHIP_DEFAULT:
503 return "disabled per chip default";
504 case FBC_ROTATION:
505 return "rotation unsupported";
506 case FBC_IN_DBG_MASTER:
507 return "Kernel debugger is active";
508 case FBC_BAD_STRIDE:
509 return "framebuffer stride not supported";
510 case FBC_PIXEL_RATE:
511 return "pixel rate is too big";
512 case FBC_PIXEL_FORMAT:
513 return "pixel format is invalid";
514 default:
515 MISSING_CASE(reason);
516 return "unknown reason";
517 }
518}
519
520static void set_no_fbc_reason(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
521 enum no_fbc_reason reason)
522{
523 if (dev_priv->fbc.no_fbc_reason == reason)
524 return;
525
526 dev_priv->fbc.no_fbc_reason = reason;
527 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Disabling FBC: %s\n", intel_no_fbc_reason_str(reason));
528}
529
530static struct drm_crtc *intel_fbc_find_crtc(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
531{
532 struct drm_crtc *crtc = NULL, *tmp_crtc;
533 enum i915_pipe pipe;
534 bool pipe_a_only = false;
535
536 if (IS_HASWELL(dev_priv) || INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen >= 8)
537 pipe_a_only = true;
538
539 for_each_pipe(dev_priv, pipe) {
540 tmp_crtc = dev_priv->pipe_to_crtc_mapping[pipe];
541
542 if (intel_crtc_active(tmp_crtc) &&
543 to_intel_plane_state(tmp_crtc->primary->state)->visible)
544 crtc = tmp_crtc;
545
546 if (pipe_a_only)
547 break;
548 }
549
550 if (!crtc || crtc->primary->fb == NULL)
551 return NULL;
552
553 return crtc;
554}
555
556static bool multiple_pipes_ok(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
557{
558 enum i915_pipe pipe;
559 int n_pipes = 0;
560 struct drm_crtc *crtc;
561
562 if (INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen > 4)
563 return true;
564
565 for_each_pipe(dev_priv, pipe) {
566 crtc = dev_priv->pipe_to_crtc_mapping[pipe];
567
568 if (intel_crtc_active(crtc) &&
569 to_intel_plane_state(crtc->primary->state)->visible)
570 n_pipes++;
571 }
572
573 return (n_pipes < 2);
574}
575
576static int find_compression_threshold(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
577 struct drm_mm_node *node,
578 int size,
579 int fb_cpp)
580{
581 int compression_threshold = 1;
582 int ret;
583 u64 end;
584
585 /* The FBC hardware for BDW/SKL doesn't have access to the stolen
586 * reserved range size, so it always assumes the maximum (8mb) is used.
587 * If we enable FBC using a CFB on that memory range we'll get FIFO
588 * underruns, even if that range is not reserved by the BIOS. */
589 if (IS_BROADWELL(dev_priv) ||
590 IS_SKYLAKE(dev_priv) || IS_KABYLAKE(dev_priv))
591 end = dev_priv->gtt.stolen_size - 8 * 1024 * 1024;
592 else
593 end = dev_priv->gtt.stolen_usable_size;
594
595 /* HACK: This code depends on what we will do in *_enable_fbc. If that
596 * code changes, this code needs to change as well.
597 *
598 * The enable_fbc code will attempt to use one of our 2 compression
599 * thresholds, therefore, in that case, we only have 1 resort.
600 */
601
602 /* Try to over-allocate to reduce reallocations and fragmentation. */
603 ret = i915_gem_stolen_insert_node_in_range(dev_priv, node, size <<= 1,
604 4096, 0, end);
605 if (ret == 0)
606 return compression_threshold;
607
608again:
609 /* HW's ability to limit the CFB is 1:4 */
610 if (compression_threshold > 4 ||
611 (fb_cpp == 2 && compression_threshold == 2))
612 return 0;
613
614 ret = i915_gem_stolen_insert_node_in_range(dev_priv, node, size >>= 1,
615 4096, 0, end);
616 if (ret && INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen <= 4) {
617 return 0;
618 } else if (ret) {
619 compression_threshold <<= 1;
620 goto again;
621 } else {
622 return compression_threshold;
623 }
624}
625
626static int intel_fbc_alloc_cfb(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, int size,
627 int fb_cpp)
628{
629 struct drm_mm_node *uninitialized_var(compressed_llb);
630 int ret;
631
632 ret = find_compression_threshold(dev_priv, &dev_priv->fbc.compressed_fb,
633 size, fb_cpp);
634 if (!ret)
635 goto err_llb;
636 else if (ret > 1) {
637 DRM_INFO("Reducing the compressed framebuffer size. This may lead to less power savings than a non-reduced-size. Try to increase stolen memory size if available in BIOS.\n");
638
639 }
640
641 dev_priv->fbc.threshold = ret;
642
643 if (INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen >= 5)
644 I915_WRITE(ILK_DPFC_CB_BASE, dev_priv->fbc.compressed_fb.start);
645 else if (IS_GM45(dev_priv)) {
646 I915_WRITE(DPFC_CB_BASE, dev_priv->fbc.compressed_fb.start);
647 } else {
648 compressed_llb = kzalloc(sizeof(*compressed_llb), GFP_KERNEL);
649 if (!compressed_llb)
650 goto err_fb;
651
652 ret = i915_gem_stolen_insert_node(dev_priv, compressed_llb,
653 4096, 4096);
654 if (ret)
655 goto err_fb;
656
657 dev_priv->fbc.compressed_llb = compressed_llb;
658
659 I915_WRITE(FBC_CFB_BASE,
660 dev_priv->mm.stolen_base + dev_priv->fbc.compressed_fb.start);
661 I915_WRITE(FBC_LL_BASE,
662 dev_priv->mm.stolen_base + compressed_llb->start);
663 }
664
665 dev_priv->fbc.uncompressed_size = size;
666
667 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("reserved %"PRIu64" bytes of contiguous stolen space for FBC, threshold: %d\n",
668 dev_priv->fbc.compressed_fb.size,
669 dev_priv->fbc.threshold);
670
671 return 0;
672
673err_fb:
674 kfree(compressed_llb);
675 i915_gem_stolen_remove_node(dev_priv, &dev_priv->fbc.compressed_fb);
676err_llb:
677 pr_info_once("drm: not enough stolen space for compressed buffer (need %d more bytes), disabling. Hint: you may be able to increase stolen memory size in the BIOS to avoid this.\n", size);
678 return -ENOSPC;
679}
680
681static void __intel_fbc_cleanup_cfb(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
682{
683 if (dev_priv->fbc.uncompressed_size == 0)
684 return;
685
686 i915_gem_stolen_remove_node(dev_priv, &dev_priv->fbc.compressed_fb);
687
688 if (dev_priv->fbc.compressed_llb) {
689 i915_gem_stolen_remove_node(dev_priv,
690 dev_priv->fbc.compressed_llb);
691 kfree(dev_priv->fbc.compressed_llb);
692 }
693
694 dev_priv->fbc.uncompressed_size = 0;
695}
696
697void intel_fbc_cleanup_cfb(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
698{
699 if (!fbc_supported(dev_priv))
700 return;
701
702 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
703 __intel_fbc_cleanup_cfb(dev_priv);
704 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
705}
706
707/*
708 * For SKL+, the plane source size used by the hardware is based on the value we
709 * write to the PLANE_SIZE register. For BDW-, the hardware looks at the value
710 * we wrote to PIPESRC.
711 */
712static void intel_fbc_get_plane_source_size(struct intel_crtc *crtc,
713 int *width, int *height)
714{
715 struct intel_plane_state *plane_state =
716 to_intel_plane_state(crtc->base.primary->state);
717 int w, h;
718
719 if (intel_rotation_90_or_270(plane_state->base.rotation)) {
720 w = drm_rect_height(&plane_state->src) >> 16;
721 h = drm_rect_width(&plane_state->src) >> 16;
722 } else {
723 w = drm_rect_width(&plane_state->src) >> 16;
724 h = drm_rect_height(&plane_state->src) >> 16;
725 }
726
727 if (width)
728 *width = w;
729 if (height)
730 *height = h;
731}
732
733static int intel_fbc_calculate_cfb_size(struct intel_crtc *crtc)
734{
735 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
736 struct drm_framebuffer *fb = crtc->base.primary->fb;
737 int lines;
738
739 intel_fbc_get_plane_source_size(crtc, NULL, &lines);
740 if (INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen >= 7)
741 lines = min(lines, 2048);
742
743 return lines * fb->pitches[0];
744}
745
746static int intel_fbc_setup_cfb(struct intel_crtc *crtc)
747{
748 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
749 struct drm_framebuffer *fb = crtc->base.primary->fb;
750 int size, cpp;
751
752 size = intel_fbc_calculate_cfb_size(crtc);
753 cpp = drm_format_plane_cpp(fb->pixel_format, 0);
754
755 if (size <= dev_priv->fbc.uncompressed_size)
756 return 0;
757
758 /* Release any current block */
759 __intel_fbc_cleanup_cfb(dev_priv);
760
761 return intel_fbc_alloc_cfb(dev_priv, size, cpp);
762}
763
764static bool stride_is_valid(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
765 unsigned int stride)
766{
767 /* These should have been caught earlier. */
768 WARN_ON(stride < 512);
769 WARN_ON((stride & (64 - 1)) != 0);
770
771 /* Below are the additional FBC restrictions. */
772
773 if (IS_GEN2(dev_priv) || IS_GEN3(dev_priv))
774 return stride == 4096 || stride == 8192;
775
776 if (IS_GEN4(dev_priv) && !IS_G4X(dev_priv) && stride < 2048)
777 return false;
778
779 if (stride > 16384)
780 return false;
781
782 return true;
783}
784
785static bool pixel_format_is_valid(struct drm_framebuffer *fb)
786{
787 struct drm_device *dev = fb->dev;
788 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
789
790 switch (fb->pixel_format) {
791 case DRM_FORMAT_XRGB8888:
792 case DRM_FORMAT_XBGR8888:
793 return true;
794 case DRM_FORMAT_XRGB1555:
795 case DRM_FORMAT_RGB565:
796 /* 16bpp not supported on gen2 */
797 if (IS_GEN2(dev))
798 return false;
799 /* WaFbcOnly1to1Ratio:ctg */
800 if (IS_G4X(dev_priv))
801 return false;
802 return true;
803 default:
804 return false;
805 }
806}
807
808/*
809 * For some reason, the hardware tracking starts looking at whatever we
810 * programmed as the display plane base address register. It does not look at
811 * the X and Y offset registers. That's why we look at the crtc->adjusted{x,y}
812 * variables instead of just looking at the pipe/plane size.
813 */
814static bool intel_fbc_hw_tracking_covers_screen(struct intel_crtc *crtc)
815{
816 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
817 unsigned int effective_w, effective_h, max_w, max_h;
818
819 if (INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen >= 8 || IS_HASWELL(dev_priv)) {
820 max_w = 4096;
821 max_h = 4096;
822 } else if (IS_G4X(dev_priv) || INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen >= 5) {
823 max_w = 4096;
824 max_h = 2048;
825 } else {
826 max_w = 2048;
827 max_h = 1536;
828 }
829
830 intel_fbc_get_plane_source_size(crtc, &effective_w, &effective_h);
831 effective_w += crtc->adjusted_x;
832 effective_h += crtc->adjusted_y;
833
834 return effective_w <= max_w && effective_h <= max_h;
835}
836
837/**
838 * __intel_fbc_update - enable/disable FBC as needed, unlocked
839 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
840 *
841 * Set up the framebuffer compression hardware at mode set time. We
842 * enable it if possible:
843 * - plane A only (on pre-965)
844 * - no pixel mulitply/line duplication
845 * - no alpha buffer discard
846 * - no dual wide
847 * - framebuffer <= max_hdisplay in width, max_vdisplay in height
848 *
849 * We can't assume that any compression will take place (worst case),
850 * so the compressed buffer has to be the same size as the uncompressed
851 * one. It also must reside (along with the line length buffer) in
852 * stolen memory.
853 *
854 * We need to enable/disable FBC on a global basis.
855 */
856static void __intel_fbc_update(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
857{
858 struct drm_crtc *crtc = NULL;
859 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc;
860 struct drm_framebuffer *fb;
861 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
862 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode;
863
864 WARN_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&dev_priv->fbc.lock));
865
866 /* disable framebuffer compression in vGPU */
867 if (intel_vgpu_active(dev_priv->dev))
868 i915.enable_fbc = 0;
869
870 if (i915.enable_fbc < 0) {
871 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_CHIP_DEFAULT);
872 goto out_disable;
873 }
874
875 if (!i915.enable_fbc) {
876 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_MODULE_PARAM);
877 goto out_disable;
878 }
879
880 /*
881 * If FBC is already on, we just have to verify that we can
882 * keep it that way...
883 * Need to disable if:
884 * - more than one pipe is active
885 * - changing FBC params (stride, fence, mode)
886 * - new fb is too large to fit in compressed buffer
887 * - going to an unsupported config (interlace, pixel multiply, etc.)
888 */
889 crtc = intel_fbc_find_crtc(dev_priv);
890 if (!crtc) {
891 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_NO_OUTPUT);
892 goto out_disable;
893 }
894
895 if (!multiple_pipes_ok(dev_priv)) {
896 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_MULTIPLE_PIPES);
897 goto out_disable;
898 }
899
900 intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
901 fb = crtc->primary->fb;
902 obj = intel_fb_obj(fb);
903 adjusted_mode = &intel_crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode;
904
905 if ((adjusted_mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_INTERLACE) ||
906 (adjusted_mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_DBLSCAN)) {
907 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_UNSUPPORTED_MODE);
908 goto out_disable;
909 }
910
911 if (!intel_fbc_hw_tracking_covers_screen(intel_crtc)) {
912 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_MODE_TOO_LARGE);
913 goto out_disable;
914 }
915
916 if ((INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen < 4 || HAS_DDI(dev_priv)) &&
917 intel_crtc->plane != PLANE_A) {
918 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_BAD_PLANE);
919 goto out_disable;
920 }
921
922 /* The use of a CPU fence is mandatory in order to detect writes
923 * by the CPU to the scanout and trigger updates to the FBC.
924 */
925 if (obj->tiling_mode != I915_TILING_X ||
926 obj->fence_reg == I915_FENCE_REG_NONE) {
927 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_NOT_TILED);
928 goto out_disable;
929 }
930 if (INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen <= 4 && !IS_G4X(dev_priv) &&
931 crtc->primary->state->rotation != BIT(DRM_ROTATE_0)) {
932 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_ROTATION);
933 goto out_disable;
934 }
935
936 if (!stride_is_valid(dev_priv, fb->pitches[0])) {
937 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_BAD_STRIDE);
938 goto out_disable;
939 }
940
941 if (!pixel_format_is_valid(fb)) {
942 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_PIXEL_FORMAT);
943 goto out_disable;
944 }
945
946 /* If the kernel debugger is active, always disable compression */
947 if (in_dbg_master()) {
948 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_IN_DBG_MASTER);
949 goto out_disable;
950 }
951
952 /* WaFbcExceedCdClockThreshold:hsw,bdw */
953 if ((IS_HASWELL(dev_priv) || IS_BROADWELL(dev_priv)) &&
954 ilk_pipe_pixel_rate(intel_crtc->config) >=
955 dev_priv->cdclk_freq * 95 / 100) {
956 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_PIXEL_RATE);
957 goto out_disable;
958 }
959
960 if (intel_fbc_setup_cfb(intel_crtc)) {
961 set_no_fbc_reason(dev_priv, FBC_STOLEN_TOO_SMALL);
962 goto out_disable;
963 }
964
965 /* If the scanout has not changed, don't modify the FBC settings.
966 * Note that we make the fundamental assumption that the fb->obj
967 * cannot be unpinned (and have its GTT offset and fence revoked)
968 * without first being decoupled from the scanout and FBC disabled.
969 */
970 if (dev_priv->fbc.crtc == intel_crtc &&
971 dev_priv->fbc.fb_id == fb->base.id &&
972 dev_priv->fbc.y == crtc->y)
973 return;
974
975 if (intel_fbc_enabled(dev_priv)) {
976 /* We update FBC along two paths, after changing fb/crtc
977 * configuration (modeswitching) and after page-flipping
978 * finishes. For the latter, we know that not only did
979 * we disable the FBC at the start of the page-flip
980 * sequence, but also more than one vblank has passed.
981 *
982 * For the former case of modeswitching, it is possible
983 * to switch between two FBC valid configurations
984 * instantaneously so we do need to disable the FBC
985 * before we can modify its control registers. We also
986 * have to wait for the next vblank for that to take
987 * effect. However, since we delay enabling FBC we can
988 * assume that a vblank has passed since disabling and
989 * that we can safely alter the registers in the deferred
990 * callback.
991 *
992 * In the scenario that we go from a valid to invalid
993 * and then back to valid FBC configuration we have
994 * no strict enforcement that a vblank occurred since
995 * disabling the FBC. However, along all current pipe
996 * disabling paths we do need to wait for a vblank at
997 * some point. And we wait before enabling FBC anyway.
998 */
999 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("disabling active FBC for update\n");
1000 __intel_fbc_disable(dev_priv);
1001 }
1002
1003 intel_fbc_schedule_enable(intel_crtc);
1004 dev_priv->fbc.no_fbc_reason = FBC_OK;
1005 return;
1006
1007out_disable:
1008 /* Multiple disables should be harmless */
1009 if (intel_fbc_enabled(dev_priv)) {
1010 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("unsupported config, disabling FBC\n");
1011 __intel_fbc_disable(dev_priv);
1012 }
1013 __intel_fbc_cleanup_cfb(dev_priv);
1014}
1015
1016/*
1017 * intel_fbc_update - enable/disable FBC as needed
1018 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
1019 *
1020 * This function reevaluates the overall state and enables or disables FBC.
1021 */
1022void intel_fbc_update(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
1023{
1024 if (!fbc_supported(dev_priv))
1025 return;
1026
1027 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
1028 __intel_fbc_update(dev_priv);
1029 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
1030}
1031
1032void intel_fbc_invalidate(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
1033 unsigned int frontbuffer_bits,
1034 enum fb_op_origin origin)
1035{
1036 unsigned int fbc_bits;
1037
1038 if (!fbc_supported(dev_priv))
1039 return;
1040
1041 if (origin == ORIGIN_GTT)
1042 return;
1043
1044 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
1045
1046 if (dev_priv->fbc.enabled)
1047 fbc_bits = INTEL_FRONTBUFFER_PRIMARY(dev_priv->fbc.crtc->pipe);
1048 else if (dev_priv->fbc.fbc_work)
1049 fbc_bits = INTEL_FRONTBUFFER_PRIMARY(
1050 dev_priv->fbc.fbc_work->crtc->pipe);
1051 else
1052 fbc_bits = dev_priv->fbc.possible_framebuffer_bits;
1053
1054 dev_priv->fbc.busy_bits |= (fbc_bits & frontbuffer_bits);
1055
1056 if (dev_priv->fbc.busy_bits)
1057 __intel_fbc_disable(dev_priv);
1058
1059 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
1060}
1061
1062void intel_fbc_flush(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
1063 unsigned int frontbuffer_bits, enum fb_op_origin origin)
1064{
1065 if (!fbc_supported(dev_priv))
1066 return;
1067
1068 if (origin == ORIGIN_GTT)
1069 return;
1070
1071 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
1072
1073 dev_priv->fbc.busy_bits &= ~frontbuffer_bits;
1074
1075 if (!dev_priv->fbc.busy_bits) {
1076 __intel_fbc_disable(dev_priv);
1077 __intel_fbc_update(dev_priv);
1078 }
1079
1080 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
1081}
1082
1083/**
1084 * intel_fbc_init - Initialize FBC
1085 * @dev_priv: the i915 device
1086 *
1087 * This function might be called during PM init process.
1088 */
1089void intel_fbc_init(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
1090{
1091 enum i915_pipe pipe;
1092
1093#ifdef __NetBSD__
1094 linux_mutex_init(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
1095#else
1096 mutex_init(&dev_priv->fbc.lock);
1097#endif
1098
1099 if (!HAS_FBC(dev_priv)) {
1100 dev_priv->fbc.enabled = false;
1101 dev_priv->fbc.no_fbc_reason = FBC_UNSUPPORTED;
1102 return;
1103 }
1104
1105 for_each_pipe(dev_priv, pipe) {
1106 dev_priv->fbc.possible_framebuffer_bits |=
1107 INTEL_FRONTBUFFER_PRIMARY(pipe);
1108
1109 if (IS_HASWELL(dev_priv) || INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen >= 8)
1110 break;
1111 }
1112
1113 if (INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen >= 7) {
1114 dev_priv->fbc.fbc_enabled = ilk_fbc_enabled;
1115 dev_priv->fbc.enable_fbc = gen7_fbc_enable;
1116 dev_priv->fbc.disable_fbc = ilk_fbc_disable;
1117 } else if (INTEL_INFO(dev_priv)->gen >= 5) {
1118 dev_priv->fbc.fbc_enabled = ilk_fbc_enabled;
1119 dev_priv->fbc.enable_fbc = ilk_fbc_enable;
1120 dev_priv->fbc.disable_fbc = ilk_fbc_disable;
1121 } else if (IS_GM45(dev_priv)) {
1122 dev_priv->fbc.fbc_enabled = g4x_fbc_enabled;
1123 dev_priv->fbc.enable_fbc = g4x_fbc_enable;
1124 dev_priv->fbc.disable_fbc = g4x_fbc_disable;
1125 } else {
1126 dev_priv->fbc.fbc_enabled = i8xx_fbc_enabled;
1127 dev_priv->fbc.enable_fbc = i8xx_fbc_enable;
1128 dev_priv->fbc.disable_fbc = i8xx_fbc_disable;
1129
1130 /* This value was pulled out of someone's hat */
1131 I915_WRITE(FBC_CONTROL, 500 << FBC_CTL_INTERVAL_SHIFT);
1132 }
1133
1134 dev_priv->fbc.enabled = dev_priv->fbc.fbc_enabled(dev_priv);
1135}
